name: BBC
caseStudyTitle: Two interactive 'foodie' quizzes for BBC iWonder
caseStudyText: With the launch of a new BBC1 series, we created two fun interactive quizzes that shine a light on all our weird and awkward eating habits.
rolloverDetails: With over 1.5m users in two days, and beating even the BBC World Cup, can you resist trying our interactive Diet Quiz?

challenge.description: Whatever we built needed to be awesome, no matter how non-awesome someone's device might be

hurdles.title: Responsive guidelines
hurdles.text:
*   Extensive UX and design reviews would require special attention to detail so that the final product would meet BBC needs.
*   Work with iWonder responsive guidelines.

hurdles.title: Audience sharing
hurdles.text:
*   Work with iWonder games guidelines.
*   Creating an app framework that will work with a variety of question types.
*   High audience and sharing figures were a requirement.

hurdles.title: Tight turn around
hurdles.text:
*   As always, a tight turn around time.
*   The total download size of the initial activity load MUST be less than 250kb.
*   Any individual asset within an activity SHOULD NOT exceed 100KB.

solution.description: We used highly flexible design solutions that utilised device interactions such as advanced swipe motions and parallax via CCS3, JavaScript and HTML5, thus reaching the largest device demographic possible.

hurdles.title: Maximising sharing
hurdles.text: To increase the appeal of the app, animated features and interactions were added. Share buttons situated at key stages of the journey maximised exposure of sharing.

hurdles.title: Agile approach
hurdles.text:
*   Agile project approach to ensure all progress and blockers are expedited.
*   Close working relationship with BBC to ensure guidelines were adhered.

hurdles.title: CMS implementation
hurdles.text: Content management was implemented so that content and javascript elements were editable.

results.description: With over 1.5 million unique users in 48 hours, it quickly became the number one iWonder guide of all time, beating even the 2014 World Cup!
